PageElement.TextBox:
On the following pages you will be asked  %System_NumberOfQuestions%  questions about privacy regulation and the Australian Privacy Principles (APPs).
 
You will be asked multiple choice questions. Answer each question by clicking the button to the left of the most appropriate response.
 
After you answer the last question, you will be given the chance to review and then submit your answers.
 
Please note that if you exit the quiz before clicking the Submit Answers button then your answers will not be saved.

To move between questions, use the ◄ and ► navigation buttons on the bottom right of the page.

PageElement.Question:
Which of the following is NOT a reason why maintaining privacy is important?


Less red tape
Fraud prevention
Good customer relations
Protecting your reputation

True or false? Customer complaints for breaching privacy may result in your EDR scheme ordering your organisation to compensate those customers.


True
False

Which of the following best describes personal information, protected under the Privacy Act?


Any information or opinion about an individual which an organisation records, where the identity of that individual is apparent, or can be reasonably ascertained, from the information or opinion
Any information or opinion about an individual which an organisation records, where the identity of that individual is apparent from the information or opinion
Any information or opinion about an individual which an organisation records

True or false? There are special levels of protection required for sensitive information and credit-related information.


True
False

True or false? The 13 APPs apply to the handling of personal information by both private and government organisations.


True
False

What policy action should you take to meet the APP requirement for openness and transparency?


Have a freely available Privacy Policy
Put a limitation on the information staff can ask for
Delete or de-identify information that is not reasonably necessary
Provide a Privacy Notice at the time of collection or as early as possible

True or false? Individuals have an automatic right to access the personal information organisations hold about them.


True
False

Which of the following statements about your APP obligations is FALSE?


If you become aware that the personal information you hold on a customer is inaccurate, you are obliged to take reasonable steps to correct the record
Your institution must take reasonable steps to ensure the personal information it holds is complete, accurate and up to date
You are obliged to correct the personal information you hold about an individual on request, following verification of the new information
You don’t have to update a customer’s personal information unless they ask you to

Who is the government regulator of privacy in Australia?


The Australian Securities and Investments Commission (ASIC)
The Office of the Australian Information Commissioner (OAIC)
The Australian Prudential Regulatory Authority (APRA)
The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC)

Choose the best answer. Which of the following is a possible consequence of a privacy breach?


A criminal may use disclosed information to set up a false account
Your customers could lose faith in your organisation
You could find it hard to attract new business
All of the above

Does the Privacy Act apply when all the identifying personal information has been removed from a record?


No
Yes

Which of the following is protected by the Privacy Act?


Statements of opinion about individuals
Information about individuals who are deceased
Records where all identifying information about individuals has been removed
Information about companies

Choose the best answer. Areas the Privacy Act regulates includes:


Open and transparent management of personal information
Collection of personal information
Use and disclosure of personal information
All of the above

Which of the following is NOT an area regulated by the Privacy Act?


Access to corporate information
Correction of personal information held
Direct marketing
Maintaining the quality and security of personal information

True or false? Disclosures of personal information to overseas entities are regulated by the Privacy Act.


True
False

True or false? The Australian Privacy Principles require institutions to set out their approach to the collection and use of customers' personal information in a written document that people may access.


True
False

Which of the following best describes the function of an organisation's Privacy Policy?


A publicly-available document setting out how the organisation deals with individuals’ personal information and individuals’ rights in relation to that information
A form used to obtain an individual’s consent to having their personal information disclosed to third parties
A consolidated statement of the organisation’s internal procedures
Guidance to staff on how to manage privacy complaints

A client complains that his file incorrectly records his current employment status as part-time hospitality when he is in full time professional employment. What is the best response?


We can update that for you. Are you able to provide me with confirmation of your current employment?
Unfortunately, there is nothing we can do to update our records
Don’t worry, your employment record won’t impact on the level of service we provide you
I’m sorry, I’ll update that for you right away

True or false? If you are pretty sure that a customer record is inaccurate, you should take reasonable steps to correct it.


True
False

Which of the following statements about correcting personal information is true?


You are obliged to take reasonable steps to update a customer’s personal information, whether or not the customer has asked you to
You don’t have to correct personal information you hold about an individual on request, following verification of the new information
Your institution must take every step possible to ensure the personal information it holds is complete, accurate and up to date
If you become aware that the personal information you hold on a customer is inaccurate, you must take every possible step to correct the record

True or false? Individuals have an automatic right to access the personal information organisations hold about them.


False
True

True or false? We are only required to correct the personal information we hold about an individual if that individual (or their agent) asks us to do so, and we are satisfied that the information in question is incorrect.


False
True

Fill in the blank. Institutions may only collect personal information that is ________________ the purpose or function for which it is being collected.


reasonably necessary to
indirectly relevant to
absolutely necessary to
loosely connected with

True or false? If you are taking a customer's application to open a children's account for one of their children, it is OK to ask the customer's marital status.


False
True

Complete the sentence. The basic principle governing the collection of personal information under the Privacy Act is that the…


… information sought must be reasonably necessary to the function or activity being undertaken
… person’s permission must always be sought before their personal information is collected

What could be considered sensitive information under the Australian Privacy Principles?


A person’s vehicle registration
A person’s tax file number
A person’s credit rating
A person’s health information

True or false? A person’s race or ethnicity is considered sensitive information under the Australian Privacy Principles.


True
False

True or false? If a customer provides personal information that your organisation did not solicit or seek, that information should be deleted or de-identified as soon as practicable.


False
True

True or false? Personal information may ONLY be used or disclosed for the purpose it was collected, or with the individual’s consent. It may not be used or disclosed under any other circumstance.


False
True

Choose the best answer. Some things you can do to help ensure the personal information your organisation collects, uses and discloses is accurate, up-to-date and complete include…


… ensuring you update customer files when advised of a change (subject to undertaking required verification procedures)
… querying information that appears to be inconsistent or out-of-date
… dealing with access and correction requests promptly
All of the above

PageElement.TextBox:
You have reached the end of the quiz.

You can now review or change your answers. Use the navigation buttons to move between questions.

When you are happy with your answers, click the Submit Answers button below. You will then see whether you passed the quiz.
